oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: NBC Bandstand - 1958-12-05 - Part 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 4 of NBC Bandstand radio show hosted by Bert Parks, with Skitch Henderson and Dody Goodman. Originally broadcast December 5, 1958, and featuring WSM and Grand Ole Opry musicians to celebrate the 1000th Opry broadcast including announcer Dave Overton, Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra, the Anita Kerr Quartet, Don Gibson, Dottie Dillard, Minnie Pearl, Faron Young, Hank Garland, and the Jordanaires. It is mentioned (in part 2) that KSTP of Minneapolis, MN is celebrating its thirtieth year as an NBC affiliate, and David Stone (former WSM announcer) is noted as the MC of KSTP's Sunset Valley Barn Dance.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marvin Hughes; WSM Orchestra; Faron Young; Don Gibson; Jordanaires; Anita Kerr Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Bert Parks introduces Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra -- Jingle Bells (excerpt) (Marvin Hughes and the WSM Orchestra) -- Wrigley's Spearmint Gum commercial -- Bert Parks announces the history of the Grand Ole Opry -- Alone With You (Faron Young) -- Hand lotion commercial (Madeleine Carroll) -- Bert Parks and Skitch Henderson tell how the Opry got its name -- Bert Parks and Don Gibson talk -- Give Myself A Party (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Vicks VapoRub commercial (Bert Parks) -- Bert Parks and Skitch Henderson thank the Nashville crew -- Q-tips commercial (Bert Parks, Skitch Henderson) -- Bert Parks introduces the Anita Kerr Quartet -- Mama's Gone, Goodbye (Anita Kerr Quartet) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Bert Parks, Dave Overton)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Parks, Bert; Henderson, Skitch, 1918-2005; Goodman, Dody; Overton, Dave; Anita Kerr Quartet; Minnie Pearl; Young, Faron; Jordanaires (Musical group); Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Dillard, Dottie; Hughes, Marvin; WSM Orchestra; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Carroll, Madeleine, 1906-1987
